website_summaries.verdict: This pack gives you flexibility in terms of the colors it offers and the strength of the material.
pros: Six-pack of viewing strips in multiple colors
Wide selection of colors so you can see what works best for specific people and materials
cons: Narrow strips are not good for pages with illustrations
Green and blue strips may be too dark for reading

customer_reviews.title: Focus for the dyslexia spectrum
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how well these assisted my little with reading! She seems to fall along the dyslexia spectrum and utilizing the colors over each line kept her eyes trained to the stories line by line while blocking out the lines before and below so the sentences didn’t get so jumbled. The learning disabilities teacher recommended them and as soon as they arrived, she became more interested in reading and acted like it was the first time she was really seeing the words!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They yellow one is great, the other colors, not really.
customer_reviews.text: The yellow highlighter strip works great, unfortunately I can't find it for a photo. The others are ok. They are thin, lightweight and the bright colors may encourage kids to read, but if you are using it specifically for making lines of text easier to read, stick with an all yellow pack.
customer_reviews.author: Tamiko Hershey

customer_reviews.title: Helping my daughter read
customer_reviews.text: These are a really nice quality for the price. My daughter will be tested for Dyslexia soon and I am trying to find ways to help her at home with learning to read and focusing. My sister had used something similar to this in the past so figured I would give these a shot! We have only been using them for a few days, but I do notice a difference in her paying attention to what word she is on and she has been enjoying picking a different color to read with!
customer_reviews.author: Bri Burford

customer_reviews.title: If colors were lighter they would be perfect
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what I was looking for, for my 2nd grader who was recently diagnosed with dyslexia. He has a hard time keeping his place on the page so I really like that these have a smaller window. I also like the variety of colors as each child does better with a different color. They are well made and sturdy. Only complaint is several are the colors are too dark to really use as you cannot read thru them very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Thin strips
customer_reviews.text: I would be vary careful with these little guide strips, specially when around little kids, they can easily get their mouth's around them and might chew on them! But all and all, I so agree that some of the colors were hard to use when reading the words, best ones out of the bunch is Yellow, Green and Red, the other colors need to be more Neon! But they work as they should!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa delaney

customer_reviews.title: Cute idea, but fall short a bit.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great idea, however the yellow seems to be the only one that’s easy to read on. The blue is also easier to read on then the other colors, they are just a tad too dark for easy reading for a kid. They are really flimsy too, I don’t have a problem with that but if your looking for a thick book mark these aren’t the ones for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Maciel

customer_reviews.title: 2 dyslexic children both appreciate these
customer_reviews.text: I have two boys who are dyslexic. They both have found these to be VERY helpful and are reading easier with them. They don't mind using these with their school work and they seem sturdy enough to hold up. Although the price is low enough I bought 3 pairs to have backups as needed. They use them as bookmarks and just read like that. They're pretty great tools.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: If you have a need for something to help you focus while reading, one of these guides will work. You need to try the different colors to choose the one color that decreases eye strain for you. It can also be used to reduce glare. Or, if you have a child who is struggling with tracking and focus while reading, this could help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful with Young Readers
customer_reviews.text: Great for my kiddos. Helps to “keep the worlds from moving around in the page” The only complaint is while the grey strips help keeps on line, I wish they made just an 8x11 that can sit on top of the page because if illustrations and things that you can’t use these with due to size.
customer_reviews.author: Mistee

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Dyslexia
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product would be useful for my niece who has reading difficulties due to dyslexia. It has surpassed my expectation! She tried different colors and decided yellow works best for her. A passage/assignment at second grade level would take her 30 minutes to get through, now she can read the work in half that time! This product is going to truly help eliminate so much of the frustration and difficulty she experiences and allow her to develope a love for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Wren5683

customer_reviews.title: Promising
customer_reviews.text: My 7- year old daughter was just confirmed to have a reading learning disability (aka dyslexia). The color mark bars just came today, but she loves them. She likes different colors as a good option for picking best bar to go with script on various colors. She said they do not have these in the special education room, and it really helps. I hope they let her use these in school
customer_reviews.author: A. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Reading Tracker
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy strip can be used in 2 different ways to track reading, either by reading through the color strip in the middle, or using the edge. It also makes a handy bookmark. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for little one
customer_reviews.text: These have helped my youngest with reading and checking to make sure her letters aren’t flipped. The issue we had was that a few colors won’t work with pencil so she can’t use them to check her writing.
customer_reviews.author: Mama B

customer_reviews.title: helping my son read
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly helpful for my son with possible dyslexia. The green is too dark to really be usable, but the others are great. They've held up so far, even with my toddler stealing them on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Archaeology cat

customer_reviews.title: Helps
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son who gets overwhelmed with all the words on a page. This helps him to focus on one line at a time. And the verity of colors helps with different book illustration background colors.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Couple

customer_reviews.title: Great idea that fell short
customer_reviews.text: The color stripes are too dark for a child to read through easily. The only color that is useful is the yellow. It does make a good bookmark through. Getting a paper bookmark and cutting a slit in the middle would be easier. I'll be returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: Tazzywmn

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this product. Helped my son to read better. My son was super excited to have a guide for reading and a book marker in one.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: love these! make it so much easier for my daughter when she's reading, better focusing, prevents her from losing her place on the page
customer_reviews.author: AliciaA

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but ok
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy and darker colors were harder to read through (although that could be an issue with my eyes) - but still readable.
customer_reviews.author: Maribel Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Makes it easier to read
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my daughter who is dyslexic. They help her to follow along better, keep her on the correct line and double as book mark.
customer_reviews.author: TxPixieGrl

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son so he can stay on track with which line he is reading. The orange, yellow, and pink are the ones that work the best. The blue and green can be hard to see through especially at night.
customer_reviews.author: Alma Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Only the lighter colors are good
customer_reviews.text: These were great except you can only see through a few of them. The darker colors are really hard to read through
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Helping my son with Dyslexia
customer_reviews.text: It’s really helping my son read. He struggles with mild dyslexia. His teacher recommended them. Great find. Great help!
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Neat tool for struggling readers
customer_reviews.text: These are great for early readers who are easily distracted. Some of the colors work better than others for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: lauras

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good quality. Helps my daughter a lot, now she is reading 80% better. So happy with this reading strips.
customer_reviews.author: Yubia

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: Only a couple of the colors are good for reading, 3 of them are too dark to read through well.
customer_reviews.author: ryrysmom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This reader was easy for my autistic child to use . Now school work goes more smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wingard

customer_reviews.title: Makes it difficult to focus
customer_reviews.text: It serves as a nice bookmark. However the colors make it distracting and thus really difficult to focus and hard to read. It was made meant for focusing on a single line at a time, but it makes it more difficult to do so with the colors in the bookmark
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Pop
customer_reviews.text: The colors are just right. I have purchased a few of these off of Amazon and I like these the best.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: My son has trouble focusing on where he left off after the last word he read. These help him focus on the highlighted area. I found that we only use YELLOW and ORANGE. The other colors were too dark.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleen Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Helps my busy students stay focused on the correct line while reading.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Multy Use
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it to guide his reading and as a bookmark.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Great for a dyslexic
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this purchase. I have dyslexia, and find that tracking from line to line can be difficult. This product reduces the strain on my eyes quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa M Butts

customer_reviews.title: Hard to see through
customer_reviews.text: The yellow one is the only one we can use for the kids books. The other colors are too dark and make it HARDER to read the text.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet M. Serrato

customer_reviews.title: Can't Read Thru Them!
customer_reviews.text: We received these quickly but they middle color is so dense you can hardly read through them.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Gehman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is dyslexic and these little book marks make reading so much better
customer_reviews.author: Cristy Spence

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Helpful tool to use to help my little reader keep track of where she is while reading.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Good line highlighters!
customer_reviews.text: These work well to keep your place. Really helps distracted readers stay on track.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine M. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Different color choices matter
customer_reviews.text: Great to help students keep their place and hold the letters and words still.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Talent

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love these!! They help a lot and I'm gifting them to mmt student workers!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The work well the keep highlighted and kids on track
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: good variety, good price
customer_reviews.text: loved all the colors...good place to start when trying this product. I will certainly be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: wimps

customer_reviews.title: Helps my son!
customer_reviews.text: These were a wonderful resource for helping my son read.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Weilnau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This helps out a lot with my sons dyslexia. He’s been reading chapter books and couldn’t focus because the sentence were altogether. This helps out a lot. It was recommended by another person who is dyslexic and I’m glad it was recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cherita

product_meta.title: Guided Reading Strips Highlight Strips Colored Overlay Highlight Bookmarks Help with Dyslexia for Crystal Children and Teacher Supply Assistant (6 Pieces)
product_meta.description:
Number of Items:6
6 Pieces guided reading strips highlight strips colored overlay highlight bookmarks help with dyslexia for crystal children and teacher supply assistant (6 standard size） 

Bright colors: 
6 Colors included, like red, yellow, blue, green and so on, just choose the color you like, or pick one works better for you when you're reading, various bright colors help one focused on reading, and make them interested in reading. 

Handy tools: 
Suitable for reading beginners, or kids who have been struggling with reading, help them read each line without jumping words, and keep on track with reading, improve their concentration and fluency, a handy tool for easy reading. 

Specifications: 
Colors: red, green, blue, yellow, orange and rose red 
Size: 19 x 3.2 cm/ 7.5 x 1.3 inches 
Material: durable PVC material 
Quantity: 6 pieces 

Package includes: 
6 x Guided reading strips
feature_bullets: Guided reading and cultivating interest: these reading highlights strips are simple and effective tools; The gray part shields other sentences, and the transparent part helps the reader to track each sentence, facilitate the use of it in the process of reading, and foster interest in reading

Good for study: designed to aid students with skipping words, skipping lines, so it's great value for strengthens visual tracking skills, blocks distractions, help teens to keep focus while reading verbatim

6 Bright colors: 6 pieces guided reading strips in 6 vivid colors（red, green, blue, yellow, orange and rose red), 1 piece for each color, satisfy you needs for reading purpose, multiple color choices can arouse children's interest in reading
Suitable size and durable quality: 19 x 3.2 cm/ 7.5 x 1.3 inches, made of quality PVC materials, durable and water resistant, easy to clean

Application: great for teachers guiding students to concentrate on reading through bookmarks, cultivate children's interest in reading, and also suitable for students to practice and review before and during examinations; It is suitable for families, classrooms, offices and libraries

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars549 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
